original: Milindapañha🔽Opammakathāpañha
analyzed: milindapañha  opamma kathā pañha
translated: The Questions of King Milinda🔽The Questions of the Wanderer Sakuludāyī🔽The Earth Simile

original: Pathavīvagga🔽6. Ākāsaṅgapañha
analyzed: pathavīvagga  ākāsaṅgapañha
translated: The Questions of Nāgasena

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘ākāsassa pañca aṅgāni gahetabbānī’ti yaṁ vadesi, katamāni tāni pañca aṅgāni gahetabbānī”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena ākāsassa pañca aṅgāni gahetabbāni iti yam vadesi katamāni tāni pañca aṅgāni gahetabbāni iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say that five factors of space should be taken as objects of meditation, which are these five factors that should be taken as objects of meditation?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, ākāso sabbaso agayho;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja ākāsaḥ sabbasas agayhaḥ
translated: “As, sire, space is entirely void,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena sabbaso kilesehi agayhena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena sabbaso kilesehi agayhena bhavitabba
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should be void of all defilements.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, ākāsassa paṭhamaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja ākāsassa paṭhamam aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the first factor of space that should be taken as an object of meditation.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, ākāso isitāpasabhūtadijagaṇānusañcarito;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja ākāsaḥ isi tāpasa bhūta dija gaṇa anusañcaritaḥ
translated: “And again, sire, space is frequented by the hosts of seers, ascetics and spirits;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena ‘aniccaṁ dukkhaṁ anattā’ti saṅkhāresu mānasaṁ sañcārayitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena aniccam dukkham anattā ati saṅkhāresu mānasam
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should direct his mind to the thought that all formations are impermanent, painful and not-self.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, ākāsassa dutiyaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: ida mahā rāja ākāsassa dutiyam aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the second factor of space that should be taken as an object of meditation.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, ākāso santāsanīyo;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja ākāsaḥ santāsanīyaḥ
translated: “And again, sire, space can be frightened;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena sabbabhavapaṭisandhīsu mānasaṁ ubbejayitabbaṁ, assādo na kātabbo.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena sabba bhava paṭisandhīsu mānasam assādaḥ na kātabbaḥ
translated: Even so, sire, the mind of the one who is devoted to mental training should be frightened of all the ways of rebirth and should not take delight in them.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, ākāsassa tatiyaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja ākāsassa tatiyam aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the third quality of space that must be adopted.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, ākāso ananto appamāṇo aparimeyyo;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja ākāsaḥ anantaḥ appamāṇaḥ aparimeyyaḥ
translated: “And again, sire, space is infinite, immeasurable, incalculable;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena anantasīlena aparimitañāṇena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena ananta sīlena aparimita ñāṇena
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should be of infinite virtue, of immeasurable knowledge.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, ākāsassa catutthaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja ākāsassa catuttham aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the fourth quality of space that must be adopted.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, ākāso alaggo asatto appatiṭṭhito apalibuddho;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja ākāsaḥ a laggaḥ a sattaḥ a patiṭṭhitaḥ a palibuddhaḥ
translated: “And again, sire, space is unattached, without substance, unestablished, unhampered;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena kule gaṇe lābhe āvāse palibodhe paccaye
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena kule gaṇe lābhe āvāse palibodhe paccaye
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should be unhampered in families, in groups, in gains, in dwellings, in impediments, in requisites,

original: sabbakilesesu ca sabbattha alaggena bhavitabbaṁ, anāsattena appatiṭṭhitena apalibuddhena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sabba kilesesu ca sabbattha alaggena bhavitabba anāsattena appatiṭṭhitena apalibuddhena bhavitabba
translated: and in all defilements everywhere. He should be unattached, without substance, unestablished, unhampered.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, ākāsassa pañcamaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: ida mahā rāja ākāsassa pañcamaṃ aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the fifth quality of space that must be adopted.”

original: Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā devātidevena sakaṁ puttaṁ rāhulaṁ ovadantena—
analyzed: mahā rāja bhagavatā devātidevena sakam puttam rāhulam ovadantena
translated: And this was said by the Blessed One, the God above all gods, when he was instructing his own son, Rahula:

original: ‘Seyyathāpi, rāhula, ākāso na katthaci patiṭṭhito;
analyzed: seyyathā api rāhulaḥ ākāsaḥ na katthaci patiṭṭhitaḥ
translated: ‘Rahula, space is not established anywhere.

original: evameva kho tvaṁ, rāhula, ākāsasamaṁ bhāvanaṁ bhāvehi.
analyzed: evam eva khalu tva rāhula ākāsa samam bhāvanam bhāvehi
translated: So, Rahula, develop your meditation that is like space.

original: Ākāsasamaṁ hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṁ bhāvayato uppannā manāpāmanāpā phassā cittaṁ pariyādāya ṭhassantī’”ti.
analyzed: ākāsa samam hi te rāhula bhāvanam bhāvayataḥ uppannāḥ manāpa amanāpā phassā cittam pariyādāya ṭhassanti iti
translated: For, Rahula, when you develop your meditation that is like space, then any pleasant or painful experiences that arise will not invade your mind.’

original: Ākāsaṅgapañho chaṭṭho.
analyzed: ākāsaṅga pañhaḥ chaṭṭho
translated: The Discussion of Space is finished.
